teaspoon package¶

teaspoon module¶

Initialize teaspoon module

teaspoon.ts_to_labels(_ts, _n, col=None)[source]¶

Convert a time series iterable into a set of features and labels ready for training.

Parameters

  • _ts (array-like) – time series to be used for training.

  • _n (int) – number of step features for each label.

  • col (any) – column identifier for dataframe time series, in case only a subsection of it will be used for training.

teaspoon.append_window(_w, _x, _y, _n, col=None)[source]¶

Helper function to append the features and labels from a time series rolling window into a feature and label array.

Parameters

  • _w (pd.DataFrame or pd.Series) – time series data window element of the .rolling(_n+1) method.

  • _x (list) – feature list to append features to.

  • _y (list) – feature list to append features to.

  • _n (int) – number of step features for each label.

  • col (any) – column identifier for dataframe time series, in case only a subsection of it will be used for training.

class teaspoon.UTSP(model, n)[source]¶

Bases: teaspoon.teaspoon._TSP

Univarate Time Series Prediction model.

This is used to predict the next step given a one-dimentional array.

Variables

_n (int) – how many past steps considered for predicting the next.

fit(_ts, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Fit model from data.

Parameters

_ts (array-like) – time series data used to fit the model.

predict(_ts, *args, start=None, horizon=1, **kwargs)[source]¶

Predict future steps from past ones.

Parameters

  • _ts (array-like) – time series to get past steps from.

  • start (any) – first step to predict from.

  • horizon (int) – how many steps ahead to predict.

class teaspoon.MTSP(model, n, col, submodels=None, n_jobs=1)[source]¶

Bases: teaspoon.teaspoon._TSP

Multivariate Time Series Prediction models.

These models are highly flexible ways of predicting future values based on a 2D aray of last steps over multiple features. While this feature is commonly used to look a single step ahead, users can specify more granularly how each step variable on a step ahead should be predicted.

Variables

  • _n (int) – number of steps before used to predict a step ahead.

  • _col (str) – column this model tried to predict.

  • _submodels (dict) – dictionary of submodels used to predict a column’s value based on previous steps. These must be either USTP models for single columns or MTSP for multiple columns. This dictionary should have a tuple (multiple columns) or string (single column) as keys and _TSP instances as values.

  • _min_cols (list) – all columns specified by the initialization.

  • n_jobs (int) – number of jobs to run for fiting and predicting.

fit(_ts, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Fit model from data.

Parameters

_ts (array-like) – time series data used to fit the model.

Get n_jobs attribute

  • horizon (int) – how many steps ahead to predict.
